content: According to data from the New York Police Department, the overall crime rate in New York City has decreased significantly over the past decade. In 2010, the city reported 536 homicides, while in 2019, there were 318 homicides. The number of shootings has also decreased from 1,471 in 2010 to 776 in 2019. Additionally, other major crime categories such as robbery, burglary, and grand larceny have also decreased over the past decade. However, there have been recent reports of an increase in certain crimes such as hate crimes and certain types of property crime.
